summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, concerning the drafting of a press release following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It contains questions and answers about the circumstances of his death, including the timeline, emergency response, and notification of next of kin and the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York and later pronounced dead at a hospital.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:30 am. Staff initiated life-saving measures. EMS arrived and, along with BOP staff, transported him to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead at approximately 7:36 am.

events.title: Epstein Arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein first arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:30 am on August 10, 2019.
Epstein was pronounced dead at a local hospital at approximately 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.
Epstein's next of kin had not been notified at the time of the email correspondence.
The FBI was notified of Epstein's death and it was being investigated.
Epstein was indicted for Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking of Minors.
